definitions.definition: Any activity designed to develop or hone a skill or ability.
definitions.example: The teacher told us that the next exercise is to write an essay.

definitions.definition: Activity intended to improve physical, or sometimes mental, strength and fitness.
definitions.example: I do crosswords for mental exercise.

definitions.definition: A setting in action or practicing; employment in the proper mode of activity; exertion; application; use.
definitions.example: The law guarantees us the free exercise of our rights.

definitions.definition: The performance of an office, ceremony, or duty.
definitions.example: I assisted the ailing vicar in the exercise of his parish duties.

definitions.definition: That which gives practice; a trial; a test.
To exert for the sake of training or improvement; to practice in order to develop.
definitions.example: to exercise troops or horses;  to exercise one's brain with a puzzle

definitions.definition: To perform physical activity for health or training.
definitions.example: I exercise at the gym every day.

definitions.definition: To use (a right, an option, etc.); to put into practice.
definitions.example: She is going to exercise her right to vote.

definitions.definition: (now often in passive) To occupy the attention and effort of; to task; to tax, especially in a painful or vexatious manner; harass; to vex; to worry or make anxious.
To set in action; to cause to act, move, or make exertion; to give employment to.
